results.headline: Review: ‘The Autopsy of Jane Doe’ Raises Mighty Goose Bumps
results.summary_short: This feature directed by André Ovredal is a shivery tour through a woman’s innards at a morgue, and it achieves real scares with a minimum of special effects.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Autopsy of Jane Doe

results.headline: Review: Another Woman on the Verge in Almodóvar’s ‘Julieta’
results.summary_short: Pedro Almodóvar’s heroine in his new movie about loss is drawn from the stories of Alice Munro; both artists are attuned to the inner lives of women.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Julieta

results.headline: Review: ‘Assassin’s Creed’ Whisks Michael Fassbender to 1492 Spain
results.summary_short: Mr. Fassbender plays a convict who experiences the actions of his assassin ancestor in this time-bending film based on the video game of the same name.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Assassin’s Creed

results.headline: Review: Two ‘Passengers’ Trapped on a Spaceship Find Love Amid Despair
results.summary_short: Jennifer Lawrence stars in this interplanetary romance aboard a mechanically doomed spacecraft making a 120-year voyage.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Passengers

results.headline: Review: ‘Sing’ Gives Animated Belters a Stage
results.summary_short: In this cartoon musical directed by Garth Jennings, a koala voiced by Matthew McConaughey tries to revive his fortunes with a singing competition.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sing

results.headline: Review: ‘Patriots Day,’ a Mosaic of Portraits From Marathon Bombing
results.summary_short: This film declines to consider the jihadist ideology that apparently motivated the Boston Marathon bombers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Patriots Day

results.headline: Review: Before Barack, There Was ‘Barry’
results.summary_short: As a junior, Barack Obama landed at Columbia University as a transfer student and sought his place in the worlds that collide in Harlem.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Barry

results.headline: Review: Beneath the Bombast, ‘Fences’ Has an Aching Poetry
results.summary_short: Starring Denzel Washington, who also directed, and Viola Davis, this film adaptation of August Wilson’s play features performances of unmatched force.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fences

results.headline: Review: ‘Neruda’ Pursues the Poet as Fugitive
results.summary_short: Pablo Larraín’s biopic about the Chilean poet pits the state versus the sensual.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Neruda

results.headline: Review: Lots of Plastic in the Face of ‘Collateral Beauty’
results.summary_short: The movie, starring Will Smith, riffs on “A Christmas Carol” as it tells a story of a man who experiences the loss of a child.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Collateral Beauty

results.headline: Review: A ‘Short Stay,’ but Long Stuck in a Rut
results.summary_short: This Ted Fendt film centers on a young man who gets a small jolt, but still can’t escape from his drab existence.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Short Stay

results.headline: Review: A Race to Raise Awareness in ‘The Ataxian’
results.summary_short: This salutary documentary follows four cyclists who bike across the country to call attention to Friedreich’s ataxia, a devastating neuromuscular disease.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Ataxian

results.headline: Review: Matter-of-Fact Mayhem Strikes in ‘The Hollow Point’
results.summary_short: Death and damage arrive out of nowhere in Gonzalo López-Gallego’s violent drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hollow Point

results.headline: Review: ‘Solace’ Enlists Anthony Hopkins as a Psychic in a Serial-Killer Case
results.summary_short: Mr. Hopkins joins Jeffrey Dean Morgan, who plays an F.B.I. agent in this disordered drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Solace

results.headline: Review: ‘Two Lovers and a Bear’ Walk Onto Some Arctic Ice
results.summary_short: Kim Nguyen’s film focuses on a pair of damaged young souls enveloped in beauty, absurdity and, despite the cold air, a lot of overheated romanticism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Two Lovers and a Bear

results.headline: Review: ‘The Wasted Times,’ a Hopscotching Shanghai Crime Tale
results.summary_short: Cheng Er’s gangland drama unwinds nonchronologically, like episodes of a mini-series shown out of order.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wasted Times

results.display_title: Ghostland: The View of the Ju/’hoansi
results.headline: Review: Goodbye to Giraffe Meat in ‘Ghostland’
results.summary_short: This documentary portrays the Ju/’hoansi of Namibia, former hunter-gatherers who struggle to survive by entertaining tourists and selling handmade wares.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ghostland: The View of the Ju/’hoansi

results.display_title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
results.headline: Review: ‘Rogue One’ Leaves ‘Star Wars’ Fans Wanting More and Less
results.summary_short: This film, masquerading as a heroic tale of rebellion, falls short of the insurgent energy of its predecessors in the franchise.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rogue One: A Star Wars Story

results.headline: Review: God Is Alive and Crabby, According to ‘The Brand New Testament’
results.summary_short: Jaco Van Dormael’s satire follows a bored deity who, from his apartment in Brussels, plays jokes on humans.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Brand New Testament

results.headline: Review: Angels, Some of This Earth, in ‘Lost and Beautiful’
results.summary_short: A palace and a water buffalo calf figure in this Pietro Marcello film — part fable, part documentary — set in the Campania region of Italy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lost and Beautiful
